home.title: Welcome to Playbypost
home.description: PlaybyPost was created to help RPG players connect with their friends. It also helps anyone who wants to use RPG as a teaching tool.
home.item-1-description: A story is a sequence of events (encounters) that happen in a game. It is the main element of the game.
home.item-2-description: An Encounter is a situation that the player must solve. It can be a combat, a puzzle, a conversation, etc.
home.item-3-description: A Task is a simple roll that each player must make to complete an encounter.
home.item-4-description: A User is a person who uses this system from a chat to play a game.
home.item-5-description: A Stage is a story associated with a channel in a chat. It is a more flexible way to roleplay a game. It requires a Storyteller to control the game.
home.item-6-description: Auto Play is a story that can we played without a Storyteller. It is a solo play or didatic school game.
home.item-7-description: A Storyteller is a person who controls the game in Stage. It is responsible for controlling the game and the NPCs.
home.item-8-description: A Player is a User who plays a character in a game. It is responsible for controlling the character and interacting with the game.
home.item-9-description: A Writer is a person who creates a story. It is responsible for creating the story, encounters, tasks, stages and others, and interacting with the players in case be the same person as the Storyteller. Writers cannot read another writers Story. They access this website.
home.list-item-10: Create a Story: you need a title, an announcement (it will be send to users) and notes (only for you)
home.list-item-11: Create many Encounters you want. Same as Story, you need a title, an announcement and notes
home.list-item-12: Choose you want to use Stage or Auto Play
home.list-item-13: For Stage, go to your Chat (integrated with this system) and run a join command
home.list-item-14: For Auto Play, you need to link all encounters under Auto Play using Add Next Encounter and make sure you have a first encounter and at least one last encounter. Then click on Publish in Details.
home.list-item-15: Use Validator button to check if you are missing something. Mainly for Auto Play.
home.list-item-17: Add Storyteller and select a channel where it will run
home.list-item-19: Encounters have 4 phases: waiting, started (players will receive a announce), running (can act) and finished
home.list-item-20: You cannot create a new Stage using the same Channel.
home.list-item-21: You cannot close a Stage if you do not finish all Encounters.
home.sub-header-4: Now. Interact with our Chat Bot calling it '@play-by-post help'
home.notes-1: IMPORTANT: You can only delete emtpy Story. Encounters you can delete only if it's not associated with Stage or Auto Play. You can run only one story (Stage or Auto Play) per channel.
home.notes-2: IMPORTANT: Storyteller should control encounters phases and NPCs using bot commands. Players can only interact with the bot using commands.
home.sub-header-5-p: We have added settings to the database to ensure data integrity and the best functioning of the application. There are some limitations.
home.list-item-22: Story title needs to be unique per writer and limited to 50 characters
home.list-item-23: Encounter title needs to be unique per story and limited to 50 characters
home.list-item-24: Task title is limited to 50 characters
home.list-item-25: Stage and Auto Play name title is limited to 100 characters
home.list-item-26: Encounter associated with Stage should have unique title per Stage
home.list-item-27: Adding a Next Encounter should have a unique combination of name, encounter ID and next encounter ID. Do not repeat.
home.list-item-28: Tasks associated with Stage Encounter should have unique title per Encounter ID and task ID. Cannot associate the same task twice to the same encounter.
home.list-item-29: Player name and NPC name is limited to 255 characters
home.notes-3: Important: These limitations are to ensure data integrity. Common database errors can be related to these limitations.
